info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:20PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN CIBOLA COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 520 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Laguna Pueblo, moving southwest at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laguna Pueblo, Cubero, Cebolletita, Mesita, McCartys, Skyline-Ganipa, New Laguna, San Fidel, Seama and Acomita. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 93 and 123. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
